title: What’s the name of the JavaScript library that Folium builds on top of?
Which of the following web map tile sources does not come built-in with Folium?
How can you source GeoJSON data for your map project?
answer_1: Calling folium.make_geojson() and passing it a country name
answer_2: Using a pencil and a ruler on a physical map
answer_3: Building your own by using visual web tools
answer_4: Fetching ready-made online resources via URLs
right_answer: Building your own by using visual web tools

title: What is a good use case for a choropleth map?
answer_2: Road and train networks in a country
answer_3: Per capita income across different defined geographical areas
right_answer: Per capita income across different defined geographical areas

title: What’s always the first part of the string argument that you pass to key_on in order to bind your data to the GeoJSON features?
How can you inverse a Brewer color palette when you pass it as an argument to your Choropleth map layer?
answer_1: Call reversed() and pass it the color palette string
answer_2: You can’t reverse a Brewer color palette
answer_3: Add "_r" to the end of the string
right_answer: Add "_r" to the end of the string
